chapterMeaning: The Yoga of Knowledge and Wisdom
sanskrit:
श्रीभगवानुवाच
मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः।
असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु॥
transliteration:
śrī-bhagavān uvāca
mayy āsakta-manāḥ pārtha yogaṁ yuñjan mad-āśrayaḥ |
asaṁśayaṁ samagraṁ māṁ yathā jñāsyasi tac chṛṇu ||
translation: The Supreme Lord said: O Partha, now hear how, with your mind attached to Me, practicing yoga with Me as your refuge, you shall know Me completely and without doubt.
commentary:
This verse marks the beginning of Chapter 7, which is considered a pivotal point in the Bhagavad Gita. Having established the foundations of karma yoga, jnana yoga, and dhyana yoga in the previous chapters, Krishna now promises to reveal the complete knowledge of His true nature. The verse emphasizes three essential prerequisites for this knowledge: attachment of the mind to the Divine (āsakta-manāḥ), the practice of yoga (yogaṁ yuñjan), and taking complete refuge in Krishna (mad-āśrayaḥ).

Krishna's promise to reveal complete knowledge (samagraṁ) without any doubt (asaṁśayaṁ) is significant. This chapter will integrate both theoretical knowledge (jñāna) and experiential realization (vijñāna) of the Divine. The emphasis on 'without doubt' indicates that this knowledge will be so comprehensive and direct that it will remove all uncertainties about the nature of reality, God, and the relationship between the individual soul and the Supreme. This verse sets the stage for understanding both the manifest and unmanifest aspects of the Divine, the material and spiritual energies, and how everything in existence is connected to and sustained by the Supreme Reality.
speaker: Krishna
